entry.title: How to pre-create the packages for the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario
entry.content:
Introduction

Several customers ran into an error when trying to import the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario using the abapGit plugin as described in this question abapGit plug-in to import the ABAP Flight Referenc... - SAP Community

As mentioned by a user in GitHub there is a workaround available by manually creating the packages before pulling the content of the GitHub repository of the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario .

Since this is a tedious and error-prone procedure I decided to provide a class in the Z-namespace that can be created in a package in the software component ZLOCAL that creates all the packages which can be run by simply pressing F9.

How to section

  1. Create a package, e.g. ZCREATE_DMO_PACKAGES with ZLOCAL as its super package.
  2. Create a class zcl_create_dmo_packages in that package.
  3. Replace the code of that class with the source code shown below.
  4. Run the class via pressing F9.

Result

Coding explained

The class starts by retrieving the names of the packages, their super packages and their descriptions using method get_package_information( ).

It also retrieves a transport that is needed for the software component /DMO/SAP according to the settings.

For each package it is being checked if it already exists, so that the class can be run several times in case something goes wrong.

Using the boolean constant value create_packages (which is set to abap_true) it is managed whether the method create_package_in_dmo_sap( ) is actually being called. 

The creation of packages and the retrieval of information needed is done by using the XCO libraries that allow access to various functionalities in ABAPCloud. (XCO Library | SAP Help Portal)

 

Sourcecode - zcl_create_dmo_packages

CLASS zcl_create_dmo_packages DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  FINAL
  CREATE PUBLIC .

  PUBLIC SECTION.

    INTERFACES if_oo_adt_classrun .
  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    CONSTANTS : co_dmo_sap_package TYPE if_xco_cp_gen_devc_s_fo_proper=>tv_software_component VALUE '/DMO/SAP',
                test_string        TYPE string VALUE '',
                create_packages    TYPE abap_boolean VALUE abap_true.



    TYPES : BEGIN OF t_dmo_packages,
              package_name       TYPE sxco_package,
              super_package_name TYPE sxco_package,
              short_description  TYPE if_xco_cp_gen_devc_s_form=>tv_short_description,
            END OF t_dmo_packages.

    TYPES tt_dmo_packages TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF t_dmo_packages WITH DEFAULT KEY.

    DATA dmo_package TYPE t_dmo_packages.
    DATA dmo_packages TYPE tt_dmo_packages.
    DATA transport_request TYPE sxco_transport.


    METHODS create_package_in_dmo_sap IMPORTING
                                                i_transport          TYPE sxco_transport
                                                I_package_name       TYPE sxco_package
                                                i_super_package_name TYPE sxco_package
                                                i_short_description  TYPE if_xco_cp_gen_devc_s_form=>tv_short_description OPTIONAL
                                      EXPORTING findings             TYPE sxco_t_gen_o_findings
                                                exception_text       TYPE string.

    METHODS get_package_information RETURNING VALUE(r_dmo_packages) TYPE tt_dmo_packages.

    METHODS create_transport      RETURNING VALUE(lo_transport) TYPE sxco_transport.

    METHODS create_put_operation RETURNING VALUE(r_put_operation) TYPE REF TO if_xco_cp_gen_devc_d_o_put.


ENDCLASS.



CLASS zcl_create_dmo_packages IMPLEMENTATION.


  METHOD if_oo_adt_classrun~main.

    transport_request = create_transport( ).

    dmo_packages = get_package_information( ).

    LOOP AT dmo_packages INTO dmo_package.

      dmo_package-package_name = dmo_package-package_name && test_string.

      "super package /dmo/sap must not be changed
      IF dmo_package-super_package_name <> co_dmo_sap_package.
        dmo_package-super_package_name = dmo_package-super_package_name && test_string.
      ENDIF.

      DATA(dmo_flight_package) = xco_cp_abap_repository=>object->devc->for( dmo_package-package_name  ).
      out->write( |check package { dmo_package-package_name }| ).

      IF dmo_flight_package->exists(  ) = abap_true.
        out->write( | package { dmo_package-package_name } does exist| ).
      ELSE.
        out->write( | package { dmo_package-package_name } does not exist| ).
        IF create_packages = abap_true.
          out->write( | create package { dmo_package-package_name } | ).

          create_package_in_dmo_sap(
            EXPORTING
             i_transport          = transport_request
             i_package_name       = dmo_package-package_name
             i_super_package_name = dmo_package-super_package_name
             i_short_description  = dmo_package-short_description
            IMPORTING
             findings             = DATA(findings)
             exception_text       = DATA(exception_text)
           ).
          IF findings IS NOT INITIAL.
            out->write( 'Findings:' ).
            out->write( findings ).
          ENDIF.
          IF exception_text IS NOT INITIAL.
            out->write( |exception occured  { exception_text } | ).
          ENDIF.
        ELSE.
          out->write( | demo mode | ).
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.

    ENDLOOP.



  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD create_package_in_dmo_sap.

    DATA put_operation TYPE REF TO if_xco_cp_gen_devc_d_o_put.
    put_operation = create_put_operation( ).

    DATA short_description TYPE if_xco_cp_gen_devc_s_form=>tv_short_description.
    IF i_short_description IS NOT INITIAL.
      short_description = i_short_description.
    ELSE.
      short_description = i_package_name.
    ENDIF.
    TRY.
        DATA(lo_specification) = put_operation->add_object( i_package_name )->create_form_specification( ).
        lo_specification->set_short_description( short_description ).
        lo_specification->properties->set_super_package( i_super_package_name )->set_software_component( co_dmo_sap_package ).
        DATA(lo_result) = put_operation->execute( ).
        " handle findings
        DATA(lo_findings) = lo_result->findings.
        findings = lo_findings->get( ).
      CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(generation_exception).
        exception_text = generation_exception->get_text(  ).
    ENDTRY.



  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD get_package_information.
    r_dmo_packages = VALUE #(
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' super_package_name = '/DMO/SAP' short_description = 'Flight Reference Scenario' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_COLLDRAFT' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Collaborative Draft' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_DRAFT' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description = 'Flight Reference Scenario: Draft Guide'
    )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Hiearchy Guides' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_DRAFT' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY' short_description =
    'Hierarchy: Draft' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_DRAFT_D' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_DRAFT' short_description =
    'Hierarchy: Draft: Data Generator' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_RO' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY' short_description =
    'Hierarchy: Read Only' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_RO_D' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_RO' short_description =
    'Hierarchy: Read Only: Data Generator' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_LEGACY' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Legacy Objects' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_MANAGED' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: TX managed E2E Guide' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_READONLY' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Read-Only E2E Guide' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description = 'Flight Reference Scenario: Reused Entities'
    )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Agency' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_CNTRY' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY' short_description =
    'Agency Extension: Country (Behavior Extensibility)' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_DATGN' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY' short_description =
    'Agency Extension: Data Generator' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY' short_description =
    'Agency Extension: Review (Node Extensibility)' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV_A' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV' short_description
    = 'Agency Extension: Review - Average' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV_D' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV' short_description
    = 'Agency Extension: Derived Events' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV_E' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV' short_description
    = 'Agency Extension: Events for Review' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_SLOGN' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY' short_description =
    'Agency Extension: Slogan (Field Extensibility)' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_CARRIER' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Carrier' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_SUPPLEMENT' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Supplement' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_UNMANAGED' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: TX unmanaged E2E Guide' )
     ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD create_put_operation.
    DATA(environment) = xco_cp_generation=>environment->dev_system( transport_request  )  .
    r_put_operation = environment->for-devc->create_put_operation( ).
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD create_transport.
    "create transport for /dmo/sap if needed or not (whether software component /DMO/SAP is of type 'K' or 'J')
    DATA(ls_package) = xco_cp_abap_repository=>object->devc->for( co_dmo_sap_package  ).
    IF ls_package->read( )-property-record_object_changes = abap_true.
      DATA(lv_transport_layer) = ls_package->read( )-property-transport_layer->value.
      DATA(lv_transport_target) = ls_package->read( )-property-transport_layer->get_transport_target( )->value.
      DATA(lo_transport_request) = xco_cp_cts=>transports->workbench( lv_transport_target )->create_request( '#Generated RAP110 tutorial transport request' ).
      lo_transport = lo_transport_request->value.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.


ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Is there a way to validate content files between two different iContent servers?
entry.content:
Hi,

Recently we did a cloning of Learning system from our legacy SF system to a new SF system. Along with that we also cloned the contents in the legacy iContent server to the new iContent server. However as we were checking we found out that some content files might have been lost in the process of cloning but we are not sure of the number of files that has been missing.

So is there a way to compare / check the content files between the legacy iContent server and the new iContent server so that we can figure out how many content files has been lost in cloning and their related details.

Any quick help / resolution would be appreciated.

entry.title: Re: SAP Business One Version Upgrade on Cloud Control Center
entry.content:
Dear SurangaWe,
 
Firstly please upgrade your SAP Business One Cloud to the latest 1.1 PL21. See SAP Note 1756002 - Verified Combinations of SAP Business One Cloud and SAP Business One for your reference.
 
You cannot upgrade an existing service unit to run a later version of SAP Business One. Instead, you must create a new service unit with the SAP Business One version that you want to run.

See following chapters from Administrator's Guide - SAP Business One Cloud:

11.4 Upgrading Service Units
7.1 Creating Service Units

Thank you.

Kind regards,
Ladislav
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Need help regarding the error: "You cannot make an as...
entry.content:
Hello

What is your material type?

If you are creating a production/process order with reference to a sales order or WBS with valuated special stock, but you have a non-valuated material, error message CO684 is triggered.

If it's a custom material type, in the customizing transaction OMS2, make sure that your material type is valuated. You can do that choosing the option "In all valuation areas" or choosing the option "By valuation area" and setting the value update on the subcreen.

Regards,
Caetano

entry.title: SAP GUI SCRIPTING: Material proposition window do not open with script running
entry.content:
Hello gentlemen,

Do you know if material proposition window can be opened with script running?

In my case: operator enters legacy code 50907 in Material, but this code is in Material_description, he confirms it by click and then registers quantity of FG to warehouse in MFP1. I have a script that takes confirmed material number, goes to folder finds .jpg project and opens picture on second monitor to compare drawing project with physical product if it is the same and operator doesnt register something else. My problem is that with script running this window proposition do not open. When there is no legacy code, meaning input from keyboard = material code in SAP - then all is good and there is no problem.

Do you know if I can have this proposition window working in SAP with script running and how to get this? Thank you

script:

Dim SapGuiAuto, SAPApp, SAPCon, session
Dim shell, fso, drawingFolder, materialValue, drawingPath
Dim lastMaterial

Set shell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
Set fso = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")

drawingFolder = "M:\Prod\photos\" 
Set SapGuiAuto = GetObject("SAPGUI")
Set SAPApp = SapGuiAuto.GetScriptingEngine
Set SAPCon = SAPApp.Children(0)
Set session = SAPCon.Children(0)

lastMaterial = ""

Do
WScript.Sleep 50000

If session.Info.Transaction = "MFP1" Then 

On Error Resume Next
materialValue = session.findById("wnd[0]/usr/subSPLITTED_SCREEN:SAPLVHUDIAL2:0053/subAREA1:SAPLVHUDIAL2:0110/tabsTABSTRIP1/tabpTAB1/ssubSUB1:SAPLVHUDIAL2:0200/ctxtPLAPPLDATA-MATNR").Text

On Error GoTo 0

If materialValue <> "" And materialValue <> lastMaterial Then
drawingPathPng = drawingFolder & materialValue & ".png"
drawingPathJpg = drawingFolder & materialValue & ".jpg"

shell.Run "taskkill /IM Photos.exe /F", 0, True

If fso.FileExists(drawingPathPng) Then
shell.Run """" & drawingPathPng & """"
ElseIf fso.FileExists(drawingPathJpg) Then
shell.Run """" & drawingPathJpg & """"
End If

lastMaterial = materialValue

WScript.Sleep 50000
End If
End If
Loop

entry.title: Which transaction code to maintain the table T77S0?
entry.content:
Hello,

Some notes are talking about maintaining the table T77S0 (with ending zero character) but don't say how.

For instance, the note 73318 - Q&A: Transport of workflow objects - SAP for Me says:

"The automatic transport connection for tasks can be switched on and off by setting the FOLDEN flag in table T77S0. (IMG path: "Tools" - "PD - Set up transport connection") : TRSP CORR X Transport flag (x = no transport)"

Which transaction code to maintain the table T77S0?

Thanks.

Sandra

entry.title: Re: Which transaction code to maintain the table T77S0?
entry.content:
The most simple way is to use SM30 and enter T77S0.

The only little problem when maintaining this table is that you lock all the entries, so only one user can maintain the table at a time.

There are several other transaction codes to maintain and lock only few lines. To know which transaction code to use, display the table T77SC with the transaction code SE16, filter the "group" and "semantic abbreviation" fields that you want to maintain, and you'll get the transaction code.

For instance, concerning "your" SAP note 73318, it's the group TRSP and the semantic abbreviation CORR, so you can deduce that the transaction code OOCR can be used:

Run OOCR. You can see that it's a subset of the table T77S0:

If you want to know if there's a corresponding customizing step in the transaction code SPRO, to obtain the relevant SAP documentation, you may search the transaction code in the table CUS_ACTOBJ (here, the transaction code SE16N):

If you now go to SPRO and search approximately the text above (for instance I need to search "Transport Connection" instead of "Set Up PD Transport Connection" to obtain some results), you should find some customizing steps:

Double-click one line to position to the given step in SPRO, make sure this step starts the relevant transaction code (OOCR), and then display the documentation:

entry.title: Re: Change the font color of header in SAP SF LMS

The Learning font color header is managed on "Theme Manager" feature on BizX side, I suggest you to check the KBA 2537158 - Theme Manager - User Assistance Documentation link - SAP for Me for additional details.

Note that if you change the color entity, the changes will be reflected in the whole HCM suite.

entry.title: Understanding DSCSA ATP Verification in Pharma Supply Chains
entry.content:
In the pharmaceutical supply chain, trust is a legal and operational necessity. The U.S. Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) mandates that companies only partner with Authorized Trading Partners (ATPs). While this sounds straightforward, the reality is that manual, fragmented verification processes can't keep up with the high volume of daily transactions, creating a major bottleneck for DSCSA compliance and efficiency.

The solution lies in automation. New technologies like the Verification Router Service (VRS) and digital ATP credentials are changing the game. They enable real-time, automated verification, replacing slow, manual checks with a seamless, interoperable system.

This article explores the challenges of DSCSA ATP compliance and highlights how these digital solutions not only meet regulatory demands but also build a more secure, efficient, and trustworthy US pharmaceutical supply chain. By adopting this forward-thinking approach, companies can move beyond reactive compliance and focus on proactive security, protecting the integrity of the drug supply chain and the safety of patients.

In this article, we will explore:

  • Understanding Authorized Trading Partner (ATP) Verification
  • Limitations of Today’s ATP Verification Methods
  • Secure Automation: VRS and Digital ATP Credentials
  • Unlocking Business Value with VRS and ATP Credential

 

Understanding DSCSA Authorized Trading Partner (ATP) Verification

ATP stands for Authorized Trading Partner. In the context of the pharmaceutical supply chain and the U.S. Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA), an ATP is any company such as a manufacturer, repackager, wholesale distributor, or dispenser (e.g., a pharmacy) that is properly licensed and registered to handle and transact prescription drugs. The DSCSA mandates that all transactions where ownership of a drug changes hands must only occur between ATPs. This requirement is a cornerstone of the law, designed to build a secure, verifiable, and transparent supply chain.

For a company to be considered an ATP, it must meet specific criteria, including:

  • Manufacturers and Repackagers: Must have a valid registration with the FDA.
  • Wholesale Distributors and 3PLs (Third-Party Logistics Providers): Must hold a valid state license or, in some cases, a federal license.
  • Dispensers (Pharmacies): Must have a valid license under state law.

ATP verification ensures only authorized partners handle medicines, preventing counterfeit or unsafe drugs from entering the supply chain. Unlike fake consumer goods, where the risk is reputational, a counterfeit medicine can be deadly. The DSCSA makes this a legal and moral duty: the pharma supply chain is a public trust, and every participant a custodian of it. A faulty phone is inconvenient; a faulty medicine is lethal. ATP safeguards patients through a secure, unbroken chain of custody.

ATP checks are not a one-time task; they are a continuous part of supply chain due diligence. Every time a product and its data change hands, the receiving party must be confident about  the sender’s status, creating a series of compliance checkpoints.

Mutual checks between so-called indirect trading partners are much more difficult to accomplish than between direct trading partners, exactly because the former do not have a direct business relationship. However, the DSCSA requires supply chain participants to do just that. To perform DSCSA-compliant Product Identifier Verification and Tracing interactions trading partners face the unusual challenge of exchanging sensitive data with parties they do not know through prior trade.

With the Verification Router Service (VRS), these checks become automated. The system verifies both the product and the requester’s ATP status in real time, acting as a digital gatekeeper. This ensures every transaction is a compliance checkpoint, with each participant safeguarding the product’s journey from origin to patient.

 

Limitations of Today’s ATP Verification Methods

The pharmaceutical industry is at a critical turning point. While operational excellence should drive compliance, outdated methods for Authorized Trading Partner (ATP) verification are causing significant inefficiency and risk, representing a fundamental failure in quality management. The 2023 DSCSA interoperability milestone has raised the bar, demanding real-time, auditable data exchange. This shift highlights the urgent need to move beyond current verification methods, which are proving inadequate for the industry's future vision of a truly secure and transparent supply chain.

Let's examine the specific shortcomings of the status quo that are preventing this vision from becoming a reality:

  1. Manual Checks: This approach, where teams manually verify licenses in public databases, is slow, lacks scalability, and provides only static, outdated data. It offers no objective evidence for a robust audit.
  2. Centralized Repositories: While a step up, these databases rely on intermittent updates, creating an unreliable system with a dangerous gap between their data and real-time reality. They fail the quality management standard of consistent process control.
  3. Locally-Managed GLN Allow Lists: These siloed, static lists are the antithesis of operational excellence. They hinder agility and cannot verify new partners, undermining the very interoperability the DSCSA seeks.

The DSCSA's 2023 vision for real-time, scalable data exchange is fundamentally at odds with current manual ATP verification methods. These outdated approaches pose three critical challenges to operational excellence:

  • Scalability: Manual checks are a logistical burden for high-volume transactions, creating a costly drain on resources that impedes growth.
  • Data Integrity: Slow and unreliable updates to static records create a dangerous time lag, exposing companies to a constant risk of compliance failure.
  • Auditability: Fragmented, unverifiable records make it impossible to provide the objective evidence required for a robust quality audit, leaving companies exposed to risk.

 

Secure Automation: VRS and Digital ATP Credentials

The future of ATP verification lies in a unified, automated, and secure system, moving beyond fragmented manual checks. This is achieved through the powerful combination of the Verification Router Service (VRS) and Digital ATP Credentials. The VRS serves as a "digital highway of trust," a secure network for real-time communication, while Digital Credentials act as a "passport of objective evidence", a cryptographically secure and unalterable proof of authorization.

When these two technologies are combined, they create a "digital handshake" that instantly verifies both product legitimacy and partner authorization. This synergy embodies operational excellence by ensuring that product safety and partner trust are verified simultaneously and with a tamper-proof record. The result is a seamless, auditable process that meets the DSCSA 2023 vision and builds a proactive foundation of trust.

Several technology providers are already enabling this vision. For instance, solutions like Spherity issue digital identity wallets containing verifiable ATP credentials. These credentials are then validated in real-time during transactions, and are designed to integrate seamlessly with existing VRS workflows, such as the SAP Information Collaboration Hub (ICH) VRS service. This ensures the system is interoperable, vendor-neutral, and can be adopted without disrupting core business processes. This approach elevates the industry's mission from merely managing risk to forging a new standard of trust.

 

Unlocking Business Value with VRS and ATP Credentials

The move to automated ATP verification with VRS and Digital Credentials delivers significant business value beyond simple DSCSA compliance.

This modern framework is superior to outdated methods like GLN lists because it offers:

  • Cryptographic Assurance: Providing a secure, tamper-proof proof of authorization.
  • Real-Time, Interoperable Verification: Ensuring seamless operations without delays.

By adopting this system, companies achieve strategic benefits including:

  • Operational Efficiency: Reducing manual workload and accelerating partner onboarding.
  • Risk Mitigation: Preventing counterfeit drugs from entering the supply chain.
  • Scalability: Supporting global operations effortlessly.
  • Cost-Effectiveness: Avoiding fines, delays, and disruptions.
  • Trust and Collaboration: Strengthening relationships across the supply chain.

Ultimately, this advanced approach transforms a compliance burden into a core driver of business excellence, security, and trust.

Conclusion

The DSCSA ATP verification requirement is reshaping the pharmaceutical industry’s approach to compliance and trust. While traditional methods have served as stepping stones, digital ATP credentials and automated services integrated with VRS represent the future of ATP verification.

By adopting these solutions, companies not only meet regulatory obligations but also build more resilient, secure, and efficient pharmaceutical supply chains. This shift is more than a compliance exercise- it is a foundation for digital trust in healthcare.

 

Authors:

Aladdin Mandishah, SAP

Christiane Wirrig, Spherity

entry.title: Clarification on SSAM Compatibility with S/4HANA 2023 FPS01 and BC Set 2405 Activation

entry.title: Re: Invoicing in SAP Ariba
entry.content:
Hello Abhinay,

Thanks for your kind words.
Regarding your query, as per my understanding, it should be possible to calculate withholding tax in Ariba B&I with tax related configuration. Request you to refer below pointers and links, give it a try and confirm back.

Withholding taxes(WHT) are not included in the invoice amount payable to the supplier. Buyers are responsible to pay withholding taxes directly to the government. Ariba Buying and Invoicing supports withholding tax at both header and line levels. Withholding taxes can only be applied on invoices and invoice reconciliation documents. By default, the WHT is calculated based on NetAmount.

entry.title: Batches in quality inspection are selected in outbound deliveries
entry.content:
Why stock in Quality Inspection was confirmed by the orders while the Availability Check is set to do not consider Quality Inspection stock?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Batches in quality inspection are selected in outboun...
entry.content:
During sales order processing, the ATP check follows the defined scope of check, which excludes Quality Inspection stock if configured that way.

However, during delivery creation, the system performs batch determination instead of an ATP check. Batch determination follows its own strategy and selection criteria (search strategy, class, and characteristics).

If the batch search strategy does not explicitly exclude Quality Inspection stock, the system may still propose such batches at delivery stage, even though they were not considered during ATP.

In summary, the reason Quality Inspection batches can be selected is that ATP rules govern sales order confirmation, while delivery batch determination follows a separate customizing logic. Unless the batch selection strategy explicitly filters out QI stock, these batches may still appear.

entry.title: Re: Agent Assignment at one shot without RHMOVE30 before starting First Workflow in System
entry.content:
Warning: I reply to a message posted a long time ago (2014).

@I042439 You are saying that you can't change the workflow customizing in QA or PRD if you define TRSP CORR = empty (with transport requests), because QA and PRD are defined as "customizing not modifiable" (transaction code SCC0). If I understand well, you are also saying that with TRSP CORR = empty in QA or PRD, you could change the workflow customizing. So, you could make TRSP CORR = space (automatic transports) in DEV, and = "X" (no transports) in other systems. Wouldn't that work?

NB: link to the SAP note: 1416609 - PD Object can be changed although changes are not allowed - SAP for Me. Just to make it clear, it says:

« The entry TRSP CORR X in the table T77S0 is set as
' ' (Blank) = automatic transport connection is activated

The table T000 has 'Changes and transports for Client-Specific Objects' sets as 'No changes allowed'
This flag means that changes in the customizing settings of the client are not permitted (client lock).

The settings of the tables T77s0 and T000 are contradictory. »

entry.title: Re: Moregraph: Metadata-driven Enterprise Architecture using Conceptual Structures
entry.content:
Really interesting work! I see Moregraph as a practical bridge between business strategy and data reality. A few thoughts:

Metadata as a strategic enabler – it’s not just documentation; it actively drives enterprise architecture decisions and helps reduce technical debt.

Breaking application silos – visualizing data objects beyond app boundaries is powerful for uncovering hidden relationships and improving integration rationalization.

Clean core & extensibility – using SAP Graph to maintain granular, clean-core data objects opens real opportunities for API rationalization and sustainable EA evolution.

Overall, it’s a compelling approach to making EA metadata-driven, actionable, and measurable. Excited to see how this evolves in practice!

entry.title: O que é o SAP Datasphere?
entry.content:
Introdução

O SAP Datasphere é a solução mais recente da SAP para gestão de dados corporativos, criada para habilitar uma arquitetura de business data fabric. Essa arquitetura permite harmonizar dados críticos de negócios em toda a organização, ajudando empresas a tomar decisões mais rápidas e precisas.

O Contexto de Negócio

Compreender o contexto de negócio no SAP Datasphere é fundamental para aproveitar seu potencial. Seja você arquiteto de soluções, engenheiro de dados ou analista, esta plataforma oferece recursos que simplificam a integração, governança e consumo de dados em escala.

O que é o SAP Datasphere?

O SAP Datasphere reúne em um único serviço recursos antes separados, como:

  • Integração de dados
  • Catalogação
  • Modelagem semântica
  • Data warehousing

A solução foi desenhada para combinar federation e ingestion de dados SAP e não-SAP, preservando o contexto e o significado dos dados, independentemente do sistema ou nuvem em que se encontram. Isso elimina a necessidade de replicar dados em mais um repositório, simplificando a landscape de dados e garantindo governança desde a origem até o consumo.

Evolução: Do SAP Data Warehouse Cloud ao SAP Datasphere

Em 2019, a SAP lançou o SAP Data Warehouse Cloud, primeira solução de data warehousing totalmente em nuvem. Já em 2023, foi apresentado o SAP Datasphere, sucessor lógico que adiciona recursos avançados de integração e catalogação de dados.

O SAP Datasphere foi projetado para colaborar com ferramentas externas, como:

  • Collibra – Governança e catalogação de dados
  • Databricks – Integração com Data Lakehouse para machine learning
  • Confluent – Streaming e eventos em tempo real
  • DataRobot – Inteligência aumentada com AutoML
  • Google Cloud – Integração completa com BigQuery e AI para criar um data cloud de ponta a ponta

Essa abordagem reforça a estratégia de abertura e interoperabilidade, permitindo que empresas aproveitem ao máximo seus investimentos já existentes em dados.

Arquitetura do SAP Datasphere

A arquitetura combina:

  • Funcionalidades de banco de dados (SAP HANA Cloud)
  • Modelagem de dados com ferramentas low-code/no-code
  • Integração nativa com o SAP Analytics Cloud para relatórios e planejamento

Os principais blocos funcionais são:

  • Space Management – Criação e monitoramento de espaços seguros para modelagem de dados
  • Data Integration e Data Flow – Conexão com fontes SAP e não-SAP, replicação em tempo real e transformações
  • Data Builder – Modelagem técnica e harmonização de dados
  • Data Catalog – Organização e governança de metadados para promover confiança e reutilização
  • Data Marketplace – Integração simples com dados de terceiros
  • Administração e Segurança – Controle de acessos, auditoria e conformidade
  • Semantic Onboarding – Importação de objetos semânticos de sistemas SAP e marketplaces
  • Consumo – Conexão com SAP Analytics Cloud ou outras ferramentas de BI via SQL ou APIs

Benefícios para Empresas

Com o SAP Datasphere, organizações conseguem:

  • Reduzir complexidade da landscape de dados
  • Preservar o contexto de informações críticas
  • Garantir governança em todas as etapas do ciclo de vida dos dados
  • Integrar e consumir dados em tempo real
  • Facilitar o autosserviço de modelagem para usuários de negócio

Conclusão

O SAP Datasphere é mais que uma evolução do SAP Data Warehouse Cloud – é uma plataforma completa para integração, governança e consumo de dados, projetada para um mundo multicloud e multisource.

Ele oferece às empresas uma base sólida para transformar dados em vantagem competitiva, combinando simplicidade, escalabilidade e flexibilidade para atender desde necessidades operacionais até iniciativas estratégicas de análise e planejamento.

entry.title: Re: Extract G/L account line items via API with OAuth2.0...
entry.content:
Hi @andre_westra67 

I recommend exploring KBA 3395176. Yes, you are correct. The reason you do not see SAP_COM_0536 in your system is that the relevant scope item is not active which is delivered with scope item 2Q2. If it is not in your scope, then the communication arrangement will not be in your system. You can verify this in Manage Your Solution by searching for the scope item 2Q2. If it is missing, your implementation partner or SAP can activate it for you.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: A cross application Fiori APP to print Adobe Forms
entry.content: Enhanced the filter for PDF Version to show only versions relevant to the chosen Application Type (or Transaction). It also shows the Content ADOBE form and Master ADOBE form associated with the versions. Please see the attached CDS View (ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V4) for this changes.

entry.title: Re: A cross application Fiori APP to print Adobe Forms
entry.content:
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Object information for ADOBE PDF'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true
@OData.publish: true

define view entity ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V4

  with parameters
    @Consumption.defaultValue : 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Appllication Type'
    @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition:                    // Annotation to link parameter with CDS view which will help to generate Text
    [ {
        entity: { name: 'ZCDS_ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM',
                  element: 'iv_object_type'}
      }]
    p1_iv_object_type : apoc_appl_object_type,
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '001'

    @EndUserText.label: 'PDF Version(1(CUSTOM), 2(SAP)..etc'
    @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition:                    // Annotation to link parameter with CDS view which will help to generate Text
    [ {
        entity: { name: 'ZPDF_VERSION_VH',
                  element: 'iv_version_nr'},
                  additionalBinding: [{ localParameter: 'p1_iv_object_type', element: 'iv_object_type' }]
      }]
    p2_iv_version_nr  : /accgo/e_ovd_version,
    //@Environment.systemField: #SYSTEM_DATE
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '2025'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Fiscal year'

    p3_iv_fyear       : /accgo/e_fiscal_year,
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '1730'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Company Code'
    //I_CompanyCodeStdVH
    @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition:                    // Annotation to link parameter with CDS view which will help to generate Text
    [ {
        entity: { name: 'I_CompanyCodeStdVH',
                  element: 'CompanyCode'}
      }]
    p4_iv_cc          : /accgo/e_companycode_vh

  as select from    zfp_pdf_form           as objtype


    left outer join I_PurchaseOrder        as po                 on  objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_ORDER'
                                                                 and po.CompanyCode         = $parameters.p4_iv_cc
  // and po.mandt = $session.client

    left outer join I_PurchaseContract     as pc                 on  objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_CONTRACT'
                                                                 and pc.CompanyCode         = $parameters.p4_iv_cc

    left outer join I_BillingDocument      as bill               on  objtype.iv_object_type   = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'
                                                                 and bill.BillingDocumentType = 'F2'
                                                                 and bill.CompanyCode         = $parameters.p4_iv_cc
                                                                 and (
                                                                    (
                                                                      bill.FiscalYear         = $parameters.p3_iv_fyear
                                                                    )
                                                                    or(
                                                                      bill.FiscalYear         = '0000'
                                                                    )
                                                                  )
    left outer join I_BillingDocument      as bill_cm            on  objtype.iv_object_type      = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT_CM'
                                                                 and bill_cm.BillingDocumentType = 'G2'
                                                                 and bill_cm.CompanyCode         = $parameters.p4_iv_cc
                                                                 and (
                                                                    (
                                                                      bill_cm.FiscalYear         = $parameters.p3_iv_fyear
                                                                    )
                                                                    or(
                                                                      bill_cm.FiscalYear         = '0000'
                                                                    )
                                                                  )
    left outer join I_SupplierInvoiceAPI01 as supp_inv_complaint on  objtype.iv_object_type        = 'COMPLAINT'
                                                                 and not(
      supp_inv_complaint.SuplrInvcAutomReducedAmount                                               = 0
      and supp_inv_complaint.SuplrInvcManuallyReducedAmount                                        = 0
    )
                                                                 and supp_inv_complaint.FiscalYear = $parameters.p3_iv_fyear

    left outer join I_SalesContract        as sales_con          on  objtype.iv_object_type       = 'SALES_CONTRACT'
                                                                 and sales_con.BillingCompanyCode = $parameters.p4_iv_cc

    left outer join I_SalesOrder           as ord_conf           on  objtype.iv_object_type      = 'ORDER_CONFIRMATION'
                                                                 and ord_conf.BillingCompanyCode = $parameters.p4_iv_cc


    left outer join I_SalesQuotation       as sales_quot         on  objtype.iv_object_type        = 'SALES_QUOTATION'
                                                                 and sales_quot.BillingCompanyCode = $parameters.p4_iv_cc
  //CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST
    left outer join I_CreditMemoRequest    as cred_memo          on  objtype.iv_object_type       = 'CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST'
                                                                 and cred_memo.BillingCompanyCode = $parameters.p4_iv_cc

  //DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST
    left outer join I_DebitMemoRequest     as debit_memo         on  objtype.iv_object_type        = 'DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST'
                                                                 and debit_memo.BillingCompanyCode = $parameters.p4_iv_cc

  // association [0..1] to I_OutputControlApplObjectType as _ObjType on $projection.iv_object_type = _ObjType.OutputControlApplObjectType
{

      //I_PurchaseOrder
      @ui.lineItem: [ {
      position: 10
      } ]
      // @ui.selectionField: [{position: 10 }]
      // @Consumption.filter.defaultValue: 'PURCHASE_ORDER'
      @EndUserText.label: 'Appllication Type'

      //   @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_ObjType'
  key objtype.iv_object_type as iv_object_type,
      @ui.lineItem: [ {
      position: 20
      } ]
      @ui.selectionField: [{position: 20 }]

      @EndUserText.label: 'Document Number'
  key
      case
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_ORDER' then po.PurchaseOrder
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_CONTRACT' then pc.PurchaseContract
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT' then bill.BillingDocument
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT_CM' then bill_cm.BillingDocument
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_CONTRACT' then sales_con.SalesContract
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'ORDER_CONFIRMATION' then ord_conf.SalesOrder
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_QUOTATION' then sales_quot.SalesQuotation
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST' then cred_memo.CreditMemoRequest
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST' then debit_memo.DebitMemoRequest
      //supp_inv_complaint.SupplierInvoiceWthnFiscalYear for 'COMPLAINT'
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'COMPLAINT' then supp_inv_complaint.SupplierInvoiceWthnFiscalYear
      else 'Under Construction'
      end                    as iv_object_nr,
      @ui.lineItem: [{ type: #WITH_URL , url: 'valueLink',  position: 30}]
      @EndUserText.label: 'PDF'
      // @ui.statusInfo: [{criticality: ''}]
      'Download PDF->|'      as showPdf,

      case
           when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_ORDER' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',po.PurchaseOrder), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', po.CompanyCode),''')/$value'))))))
           when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_CONTRACT' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',pc.PurchaseContract), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', pc.CompanyCode),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'  then
      // concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType), concat(concat('IvVersionNr=','000'),concat(concat('IvObjectNr=',bill.vbeln), concat(concat('IV_FYEAR=','0000'),concat('IV_CC=', bill.bukrs))))))
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',bill.BillingDocument), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', bill.CompanyCode),''')/$value'))))))
                        when objtype.iv_object_type = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT_CM'  then
      // concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.OutputControlApplObjectType), concat(concat('IvVersionNr=','000'),concat(concat('IvObjectNr=',bill.vbeln), concat(concat('IV_FYEAR=','0000'),concat('IV_CC=', bill.bukrs))))))
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',bill_cm.BillingDocument), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', bill_cm.CompanyCode),''')/$value'))))))

            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_CONTRACT' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',sales_con.SalesContract), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'ORDER_CONFIRMATION' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',ord_conf.SalesOrder), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_QUOTATION' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',sales_quot.SalesQuotation), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',cred_memo.CreditMemoRequest), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',debit_memo.DebitMemoRequest), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'COMPLAINT' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',supp_inv_complaint.SupplierInvoiceWthnFiscalYear), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''',''),''')/$value'))))))

           else ''
          end                as valueLink
      //Associations
      // _ObjType
}
where
      objtype.iv_object_type = $parameters.p1_iv_object_type
  and objtype.iv_version_nr  = $parameters.p2_iv_version_nr

entry.title: Program RHTTCP77 to fix some errors in SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables"
entry.content:
In this blog post, we'll see the program RHTTCP77 which can fix some of the errors in the SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables".

There's also the program RHSOBJCH which can fix other errors, and is presented in this other blog post: Program RHSOBJCH to fix some errors in SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" - SAP Community.

That said, let's see the program RHTTCP77 now.

The transaction SWU3 is used to configure SAP Business Workflow. All the activities should be green.

But it's very frequent to have some SAP internal errors in the activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" (red cross):

Execute the activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" to see the errors:

The program RHTTCP77 cannot fix the above errors but it can fix the below errors:

Run the program RHTTCP77 in test mode to see what data could be copied from the default configuration stored in the client 000:

Too many updates here for just 2 errors concerning the table T777I ...

So, let's run again RHTTCP77 to filter to the only problem concerning T777I:

Let's see the new and changed entries in T777I (NB: here, we're still in the test mode):

Now that you have seen the impacts, you may run RHTTCP77 in real mode, by switching off the test mode:

Back to SWU3, it's now green:

Congratulations, you did it !

NB: the SAP note 3329771 - 'Check Entries from HR Control Tables' in SWU3 fails with error 'Not an entry in table SOBJ' - SAP for Me is of no interest, it just repeats to run the programs RHTTCP77 and RHSOBJCH.

There's also the SAP note 2366252 - Transaction SWU3 explained - SAP for Me, which again is of no interest because it repeats the documentation displayed inline in SWU3. Or did I miss something?

entry.title: Program RHSOBJCH to fix some errors in SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables"
entry.content:
In this blog post, we'll see the program RHSOBJCH which can fix some of the errors in the SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables".

There's also the program RHTTCP77 which can fix other errors, which is presented in this blog post: Program RHTTCP77 to fix some errors in SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" - SAP Community.

That said, let's see the program RHSOBJCH now.

The transaction SWU3 is used to configure SAP Business Workflow. All the activities should be green.

But it's very frequent to have some SAP internal errors in the activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" (red cross):

Execute the activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" to see the errors:

There's no risk to fix the data in the transaction SOBJ by the standard program RHSOBJCH.

The SWU3 information text (first screenshot) talks about PDST or PDWS but it can also concern PDST_BASE or PDWS_BASE in recent ABAP versions (test with ABAP 7.58), as you can see if you run RHSOBJCH (for information, it doesn't update anything if you don't press Adjust):

All the entries above are missing in the transaction SOBJ.

Here's the content of transaction SOBJ, concerning the Piece List of object PDST_BASE, before and after running the program RHSOBJCH:

  1. Before running RHSOBJCH, we can see these tables in the Piece List of SOBJ:
  2. After running "Adjust" in RHSOBJCH:


    We can now see these new tables in the Piece List inserted by RHSOBJCH:

Congratulations, you did it !

NB: the SAP note 3329771 - 'Check Entries from HR Control Tables' in SWU3 fails with error 'Not an entry in table SOBJ' - SAP for Me is of no interest, it just repeats to run the programs RHTTCP77 and RHSOBJCH.

There's also the SAP note 2366252 - Transaction SWU3 explained - SAP for Me, which again is of no interest because it repeats the documentation displayed inline in SWU3. Or did I miss something?

entry.title: Re: Automatic Workflow Customizing - Check entries from H...

The two programs RHTTCP77 and RHSOBJCH are harmless as far as I know, they just repair standard customizing. Of course, if you did a modification of standard in the tables T77*, you need to first analyze more in depth.

For more information about these two programs, I have published these two blog posts:

Program RHTTCP77 to fix some errors in SWU3 activi... - SAP Community

Program RHSOBJCH to fix some errors in SWU3 activi... - SAP Community

entry.title: Re: Client Certificate Authentication in SAP Cloud Integration: Configuration and Best Practices
entry.content:
Hi @BishalDeb 

Apologies for the late response.

Q:What i understood is keytype "External Certificate" should be chosen when Client gives us the certificate from their side.

A: Yes that is correct.

Q:Additionally, in HTTPS Adapter, we need to change the auth from user role to Client certificate and upload the root certificate which client will provide.

A: Not necessarily, the exact same steps can be taken with the option "External Certificate", as with our example of creating the Certificate in the BTP Cockpit.

When you are creating the Service Instance, you can specify the Role the same way, and it will be associated with the uploaded External certificate.

Q:Additionally, assumption would be that the same certificate will be already added in client's SAP system using STRUST.
If not then they should create new Client PSE and then import their own certificate along with the Load balancer certificates which we downloaded from Cloud Integration.

And then we create RFC with the required host and path and then choose the appropriate SSL certificate from the dropdown.

A: Yes, that is completely correct.

Best Regards,
Adam

entry.title: SAP GUI version is compatible for this new released Mac OS Tahoe 26 version
entry.content:
Hello Team,

      Recently Apple announce a new Operating System called MacOS Tahoe 26
      version. we need to know that what SAP GUI version is compatible for
      this new released Mac OS Tahoe 26 version.

      In our environment for the Mac devices we have a current version
      installed SAP GUI 780 rev 5. So just want to know is this a compatible
      with Tahoe 26 version ? or there is another version SAP vendor has
      released for this Mac new O.S.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SAP GUI version is compatible for this new released M...
entry.content:
Hello customer,

As per your request please refer to SAP Note 3485708 - SAP GUI for Java 8.10 Requirements:

Software

  • The embedded SapMachine 21 is used.
  • macOS Sonoma 14, see SAP Note 3385617 for details.
  • macOS Sequoia 15.2 and newer, see SAP Note 3517261 for details.
  • macOS 26 (Tahoe) is still under testing, see SAP Note 3656940 for details.

SAP is currently in the process of running acceptance tests on macOS 26 (Tahoe).

It is not recommended to use SAP GUI for Java on macOS 26 (Tahoe) until these tests are concluded.

SAP Note 3485708 will be updated once macOS 26 (Tahoe) is finally supported.

 

Keep in mind, the SAP GUI for Java 8.10 is the only available and supported version.  Older Releases are no longer supported, for support deadline, see note 147519.

Best Regards,

SAP Support
